item.title: Name of the work 2
item.description: When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the headline of Alphabet Village and the subline of her own road, the Line Lane.

item.title: Name of the work 3
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Item without image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Email Template for Faculty Mentor
item.description: Dear Dr. []: My name is [] and I am currently a [state what you currently doing] at []. I admire your research on [X] and I want to ask you about the possibility of working with you towards my [masters/PhD]. [Insert a few ideas or questions you have about their research on topics you might want to work on]. Are you accepting graduate students in the next year? Thank you for your consideration and I hope to hear from you soon,

item.title: Applying to Graduate School in STEM
item.description: Here are my recommendations and a suggested timeline for applying for a PhD or masters program in STEM, more specifically the life sciences. I have served on the admissions committee for my PhD program, and have some general thoughts on how best to prepare your application from that experience. I hope for this to help demystify some of the process for anyone who needs it. Steps Request Letters of Recommendation Do this early and get a feel for if your recommender as advice for programs to consider.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
